body_html:
If you know the batch size ahead of time, pass it in instead of None. For example --input_shape=3,440

If the batch size will change during inference, you can pass anything in and resize the input tensors during inference, when you know the size of the batch. Take a look at the apis.md file.
body_text:
If you know the batch size ahead of time, pass it in instead of None. For example --input_shape=3,440
If the batch size will change during inference, you can pass anything in and resize the input tensors during inference, when you know the size of the batch. Take a look at the apis.md file.
body:
If you know the batch size ahead of time, pass it in instead of None. For example --input_shape=3,440

If the batch size will change during inference, you can pass anything in and resize the input tensors during inference, when you know the size of the batch. Take a look at the apis.md file.
